# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), ' ', '_'))
end

# Example usage:
println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Outputs "my_column"
```
The function `clean_column` takes a string `col` as input and uses the built-in functions `lowercase`, `replace`, and `strip` to clean up the column name. It converts the entire string to lower case, replaces all spaces with underscores in the string (and also removes any leading or trailing whitespaces), then returns the cleaned up version of the string.
